info.name: HyperAccounts REST API for Sage 50cloud
info.description:
The HyperAccounts API for Sage 50cloud Accounts uses REST principles to make it easy for third party developers to Create, Read, Update and Search Records in the Sage Database in real-time. All data sent to it or received from it will be in a JSON format.

Optional Fields

If you want to clear the value you must pass an empty string as the value. missing properties or null values will be ignored to prevent data loss by customers that accidentally miss a field, maybe from having an older version of the API.

Other optional types can either be omitted completely or set to null.

Authentication

The API uses Simple API Key for authentication. This requires all requests to have an AuthToken Header with the customers unique token in each request or a 403 forbidden error will be returned.

Please contact Hyperext support via support@hyperext.com to obtain your unique token if you do not already have it.

Release 1.5.17

  • Added new global optional fields to Sales invoice

Release 1.5.16

  • Added optional netAmount field to salesInvoice Item to reverse calculate discounts and resolve floating point issues on fractional amounts

  • On salesInvoice endpoint requests with invoiceTypeCode = 3 or 4 will now use next Credit Number from Sage rather than next Invoice Number as before

  • On POST purchaseOrder user can optionally specify own PO orderNumber in place of autogenerated number from Sage. Includes protection against overwriting existing records with same ref.

Release 1.5.15

  • Added new projectCostCode endpoint

Release 1.5.14

  • Stock adjustments fetch previous cost price if not provided

  • Compound discount feature on sales invoices

Release 1.5.13

  • Added search price endpoint

  • Added new fields to search Product endpoint

  • Fixed an issue when posting/patching sales invoices

Release 1.5.12

  • Added additional fields to customer and searchSalesLedger to manage sales discounting and created new webImage endpoint for product api/product/{stockCode}/webImage

Release 1.5.11

  • Further improved connection handling performance. Enabled ‘details’ field to be used in salesInvoice items for service items with stockCode other than ‘S3’

Release 1.5.10

  • Changes to Sage connection handling logic to improve performance under load

  • Added runtime debugging functionality (internal use only)

  • Added purchaseNominalCode to Product, added itemsNet and itemsTax to GET salesInvoice

Release 1.5.9

  • Adapted Transaction Post endpoint to handle case where Sage BASE Currency is other than GBP

Release 1.5.8

  • Added Search Invoice endpoint

Release 1.5.7

  • Added search project endpoint

  • Fixed issue with consignmentRef field in sales invoice

  • Added accountStatus field to customer

  • Fixed an issue with patching a product and added location

  • Added projectID and costCodeID fileds to purchase order

Release 1.5.6

  • Added additional fields to audit usage response

  • Added additional fields to supplier endpoint

  • Added GET tax code by ID

  • Added additional fields to customer endpoint

  • Added LIKE functionality in search

  • Added consignmentRef to sales invoice

Release 1.5.5

  • Added departments endpoint

  • Added Search usage endpoint

  • Improved endpoint response information on Update Ledgers

Release 1.5.4

  • Added a GET request to get stock adjustments

Release 1.5.3

  • Fixed an issue with sales credits numbering

Release 1.5.2

  • Added Due date to purchase order

  • Added api/stock

  • Added api/searchPurchaseOrder

Release 1.5.1

  • Added multi company support

  • Price list endpoint now uses ODBC (performance improvement)

  • Added VAT number, email 1 and email 2 fields to customer

  • Fixed credit invoice numbering issue

  • Added due date field to purchase order endpoint

Release 1.5.0

  • Added chart of accounts endpoint

  • Added control endpoint

  • Added ability to search by date time

Release 1.4.14

  • Added company endpoint

  • Fixed issue with partial data on customer patch

Release 1.4.13

  • Added additional fields to search audit headers and splits

Release 1.4.12

  • Stock code restricted to 30 chars on sales order and sales invoice

  • Added patch to sales invoice endpoint

Release 1.4.11

  • Added search purchase ledger endpoint

  • Removed character limit on stock code

Release 1.4.10

  • Additional fields added

Release 1.4.9

  • Added additional fields to search sales order

  • Added balance to nominal endpoint (read only)

  • Changed older agedBalance from 160 to 120

Release 1.4.8

  • Added additional fields to product and sales ledger search

Release 1.4.7

  • Added additional fields to product and sales ledger search

Release 1.4.6

  • Added additional fields to product and sales ledger search

  • Fixed a currency related issue with transactionPost

  • Added search splits endpoint

Release 1.4.5

  • Added departmentNumber to purchase order endpoint

  • Added analysis fields to project

  • Made accountRef on project optional

Release 1.4.4

  • Added Project transactions endpoint

  • Added custom accountRef in customer endpoint

Release 1.4.3

  • Added agedDebtors endpoint

Release 1.4.2

  • Added VAT number, email2 and email3 properties to customer endpoint

Release 1.4.1

  • Fixed an issue with stock code being truncated to 15 chars on the Sales Invoice endpoint

  • Fixed an issue when patching a purchase order

Release 1.4.0

  • Added shouldUpdateLedgers flag to sales invoice endpoint

  • Added shouldAllocatePayment to transaction post endpoint

Release 1.3.8

  • Added searchSalesLedgers endpoint

Release 1.3.7

  • Added onHold property to customer model

Release 1.3.6

  • Added nominal endpoint

Release 1.3.5

  • Added project endpoint

  • Date parsing fix

Release 1.3.4

  • Added address fields to Sales Order endpoint

Release 1.3.3

  • Added transactionPost endpoint

  • Added paymentDueDate and projectId to sales invoice

  • Added DELETE endpoints to sales/purchase order

  • Added foreign currency related fields to sales invoice

Release 1.3.2

  • Fixed an issue with Patch supplier endpoint

Release 1.3.1

  • Added Purchase order GET and PATCH endpoints

  • Added ID field to currency list

  • Added supplierOrderNumber to Purchase orders

Release 1.3.0

  • Added transactionPost endpoint

  • Receipt endpoints share code/models with transactionPost

Release 1.2.10

  • Added foreignRate and invoiceTypeCode to Sales Invoice

  • Added refundOnAccount endpoint

Release 1.2.9

  • Added web category fields to product search

Release 1.2.8

  • Fixed an issue with supplier currency field

Release 1.2.7

  • Added paymentOnAccount endpoint

  • Fixed issue with search products

  • Added status fields to search sales order

  • Added printed flag to sales invoice

  • Added customer balance to response

Release 1.2.6

  • Added orderDueDate to sales order

  • Added GET Currency

Release 1.2.5

  • Added products search

  • Added country code to customers

  • Allow manually entering comment 1 & 2 on sales order items

Release 1.2.4

  • Added journal endpoint

  • Added bank endpoint

  • Fixed an issue with sales invoice item details not showing

Release 1.2.3

  • Added ability to update sales order account ref

  • Added Get Sales Invoice endpoint

  • Added InvRef field to search sales order

Release 1.2.2

  • Search sales order table

  • General small improvements

Release 1.2.1

  • Small bug fixes in sales order and get sales receipt by invoice

Release 1.2.0

  • Added api/search/auditHeaders search endpoint

Release 1.1.8

  • Added post sales receipt endpoint

  • Fixed a bug that reported false when fetching suppliers

  • Fixed a bug with generating customer references

  • Added datePosted field to GET sales receipts

Release 1.1.7

  • Added departmentNumber field to salesOrders

  • Bug fix with company name

Release 1.1.6

  • Bug fixes with sales orders

Release 1.1.5

  • Added product endpoint

  • Added http status code

Release 1.1.4

  • Fixed a bug in posting a sales order

  • Fixed missing dependency issue

  • Added get sales orders and sales order by order number

  • Fixed an issue with special characters in account ref

Release 1.1.3

  • Fixed a bug when fetching part-paid sales receipts

  • Fixed an issue where you couldn’t clear an optional text field with an empty string

  • Added sendLettersElectronically to customer object

Release 1.1.2

  • Additional fields added to customer and sales invoice

  • Some fields changed from mandatory/optional in sales invoice

  • Basic token based authentication added

Release 1.1.1

  • Multi currency changes

Release 1.0.0

  • Initial Build

request.description:
PATCH Update Exchange Rates

  • Description: Updates Currencies list from Settings.

  • Endpoint URL: api/currency

  • Method: PATCH

  • Parameters:

id // required, int, max number 100
code // required, string, max 3 chars
emuMember // optional, int, 0 = false 1 = true
exchangeRate // optional, double, max 9 chars
majorUnit //  optional, string, max 20 chars
minorUnit //   optional, string, max 20 chars
name // optional, string, max 30 chars
symbol // optional, string, max 3 chars

Get Countries

  • Description: Returns Countries.

  • Endpoint URL: api/country

  • Method: GET

  • Parameters: none

response.name: Read Countries

request.description:
Search Customers

  • Description: Searches for customers.

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchSalesLedger

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

    -"field" // Sage table field i.e RECORD_MODIFY_DATE, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - "type" // See explanation below
    - "value" // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

NOTES:

  • Dates must be provided in the dd/mm/yyyy format when searching this table. Can also support time in hh:mm:ss format.

  • Fields email4 to email6 are only available on V29 of Sage and upwards

request.description:
POST Create Customer

  • Description: Creates a new customer record in Sage. Automatically generates unique accountRef in the form 'AAAA0000' returned in successful response

  • Endpoint URL: api/customer

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

accountRef // optional, string, max 8 chars to override auto generation
name // required, string, max 60 chars
contactName // optional, string, max 30 chars
customerName // optional, string, max 30 chars
tradeContact // optional, string, max 30 chars
telephone // optional, string, max 30 chars
address1 // optional, string, max 60 chars
address2 // optional, string, max 60 chars
address3 // optional, string, max 60 chars
address4 // optional, string, max 60 chars
address5 // optional, string, max 60 chars
deliveryAddress1 // optional, string, max 60 chars
deliveryAddress2 // optional, string, max 60 chars
deliveryAddress3 // optional, string, max 60 chars
deliveryAddress4 // optional, string, max 60 chars
deliveryAddress5 // optional, string, max 60 chars
countryCode // e.g GB max 2 chars, optional
creditLimit // optional, int
currency // Int max 1 chars, optional, use values from sage Settings > Currencies
email // optional, string, max 255 chars
email2 // optional, string, max 255 chars
email3 // optional, string, max 255 chars
email4 // optional, string, max 255 chars
email5 //optional, string, max 255 chars
email6 // optional, string, max 255 chars
accountStatus // optional,  int, max 2 digits
eoriNumber // optional, string, max 60 chars
defTaxCode // optional, int, max 2 digits
defNomCodeUseDefault // optional, bool 
defNomCode // optional, string, max 8 chars
terms // optional, string, max 30 chars
termsAgreed // optional, bool
bankAccountName // optional, string, max 60 chars
bankSortCode // optional, string, max 10 chars
bankAccountNumber // optional, string, max 60 chars
bacsRef // optional, string, max 60 chars
iban // optional, string, max 60 chars
bicSwift // optional, string, max 60 chars
rollNumber // optional, string, max 60 chars
addtitionalRef1 // optional, string, max 60 chars
addtitionalRef2 // optional, string, max 60 chars
addtitionalRef3 // optional, string, max 60 chars
paymentType // optional, int, max 2 chars
sendInvoicesElectronically // optional, bool
sendLettersElectronically // optional, bool
analysis1 // optional, string, max 30 chars
analysis2 // optional, string, max 30 chars
analysis3 // optional, string, max 30 chars
analysis4 // optional, string, max 30 chars
analysis5 // optional, string, max 30 chars
analysis6 // optional, string, max 30 chars
deptNumber // optional, int, max 2 chars
paymentDueDays // optional, int, max 2 chars
paymentDueFrom // optional, int, max 1 chars
inactiveAccount // optional, bool
vatNumber // optional, string, max 20 chars
accountStatus // optional, int, max 2 chars
onHold // optional, bool
creditPosition // optional, int, max 1 chars
discountRate // optional, double, max 8 chars
discountType // optional, byte, enum type, max 1 chars
www // optional, string, max 255 chars

Note:

  • Fields email4 to email6 are only available on V29 of Sage and upwards

Payment Due From Status

Value    Description
0    Days After Invoice Date
1    Days From The First Day Of The Following Month
2    Days Before The Last Day Of The Following Month
3    Days Of The Month
4    Days From 1 Month After Invoice Date

Sales Discount Type

Constant         Value            Description 
sdoNoDiscount         0         No Discount Applied 
sdoValueDiscount     1         Discount Applied by Invoice Value 
sdoQtyDiscountA     2         Discount Applied by Banding A 
sdoQtyDiscountB     3         Discount Applied by Banding B 
sdoQtyDiscountC     4         Discount Applied by Banding C 
sdoQtyDiscountD     5         Discount Applied by Banding D 
sdoQtyDiscountE     6         Discount Applied by Banding E

Credit Position Status

Value    Description
0        Good
1        Reminder
2        Warning
3        Legal

 telephone2 // String (max 30 chars) optional
 vatNumber //  String (max 20 chars) optional
 taxCode // Double (max 8 chars) optional

Create Customer Address

  • Description: Updates a customer address record in Sage

  • Endpoint URL: api/customerAddress

  • Method: PATCH

  • Parameters:

 accountRef // String (max 8 chars), required, customer account must exist
 addresNumber // Int (max 2 chars), required
 addressLine1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 addressLine2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 addressLine3 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 addressLine4 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 addressLine5 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 countryCode // e.g GB (max 2 chars), optional
 role // String (max 30 chars), optional
 contact // String (max 30 chars), optional
 description // String (max 60 chars), optional
 email //  String (max 255 chars), optional
 fax // String (max 30 chars), optional
 name // String (max 60 chars), optional
 notes // String (max 60 chars), optional
 telephone // String (max 30 chars), optional
 telephone2 // String (max 30 chars) optional
 vatNumber //  String (max 20 chars) optional
 taxCode // Double (max 8 chars) optional

Search Customer Address

  • Description: Searches exisiting customer address

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchCustomerAddress

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e RECORD_MODIFY_DATE, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

request.description:
Search Purchase Ledgers (suppliers)

  • Description: Searches the PURCHASE_LEDGER table in Sage.

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchPurchaseLedger

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e RECORD_MODIFY_DATE, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

request.description:
Get Supplier

  • Description: Fetches a single supplier. If wanting to get full list of suppliers use - api/searchPurchaseLedger.

  • Endpoint URL: api/supplier/{accountRef}

  • Method: GET

  • Parameters: accountRef

response.name: Read Supplier

Search Products

  • Description: Searches the STOCK table in Sage.

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchProduct

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e INV_REF, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

request.description:
Get Customer Price Lists

  • Description: Fetches price lists single customer.

  • Endpoint URL: api/priceList/{accountRef}

  • Method: GET

  • Parameters: accountRef

request.description:
Search Prices

  • Description: Searches the PRICE table in Sage.

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchPrice

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e RECORD_MODIFY_DATE, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

request.description:
Search Sales Order

  • Description: Searches Sales Order.

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchSalesOrder

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e RECORD_MODIFY_DATE, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

Allocation Status

Value    Description
0        Not Allocated
1        Partially Allocated
2        Fully Allocated
3        Cancelled
4        Held

Dispatch Status

Value    Description
0        Not Dispatched
1        Partially Dispatched
2        Fully Dispatched

request.description:
Post Create Sales Order

  • Descitpion: Creates new sales order

  • Endpoint URL: api/salesOrder

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

 customerAccountRef // String (max 8 chars), required, customer account must exist
 customerOrderNumber // String (max 60 chars), optional
 orderDate // String, Date (dd/mm/yyyy), optional
 customerTelephoneNumber // String (max 30 chars), optional
 contactName // String (max 30 chars), optional
 userName // String (max 30 chars), optional
 address1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address3 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address4 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address5 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delName // String (max 30 chars), optional, 60 chars on V29 or newer
 delAddress1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress3 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress4 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress5 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 netValueDiscountAmount // Double (max 8 chars), optional
 netValueDiscountDescription // string (max 30 chars), optional
 carrNet // Double (max 8 chars), optional 
 carrTax // Double (max 8 chars), optional
 foreignRate // Double (max 2 chars), optional
 notes1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 notes2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 notes3 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 analysis1 // String (max 30 chars), optional
 analysis2 // String (max 30 chars), optional
 analysis3 // String (max 30 chars), optional
 carrNomCode // String (max 8 chars), optional
 carrTaxCode // Int (max 2 chars), optional
 currency // Int (max 1 chars), optional, use values from sage Settings > Currencies
 departmentNumber // Int, optional 
 carriageDepartmentNumber // Int, optional
 globalNominal // String,(max 8 chars) optional
 globalDetails // String, (max 60 chars), optional
 globalTaxCode // Int, (max 8 chars), optional
 globalDepartment // Int, (max 2 chars), optional
 consignmentRef  // String (max 30 chars), optional
 courierNumber // Int (Max 30 chars), optional
 orderDueDate // Date (dd/mm/yyyy), optional
 quoteStatus // Int (max 2 chars), optional
 quoteExpiry // Date (dd/mm/yyyy), optional (only used for quotes)
 orderType // Int, optional
 settlementDiscRate // double, (max 8 chars), optional
 settlementDueDays  // int, (max 5 chars), optional
 bankRef // String, (max 8 chars), optional
 fillGlobalsFromCustomerDefaults // bool, optional
 orderItemsDataFromStockItemData // bool, optional
 invoiceItems // array
        stockCode // String (max 30 chars), required
        description // String (max 60 chars for V28 or older, max 120 for V29 or newer), optional
        quantity // Double (max 8 chars), required
        unitPrice  // Double (max 8 chars), required
        unitOfSale // string, max 8 chars, optional
        taxRate // Double eg 20.0, (max 8 chars), required
        taxCode // Int eg 1, (max 2 chars), required
        discount // Double eg 25.0, percentage discount (max 8 chars), required
        discountAmount // Double (max 8 chars), optional
        netAmount // Double (max 8 chars), optional
        departmentNumber // Int, required
        nominal // String (max 8 chars), required to update ledgers
        details // String (1023 chars), only for service invoice items
        comment1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
        comment2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
        dueDate // Date (dd/mm/yyyy), optional
        serviceFlag // int, optional (set to 2 for Service Item)
// THESE THREE FIELDS ONLY USED FOR SALES ORDER **QUOTATIONS**
 orderType // Int, optional, set to value 9 for a quote
 quoteExpiry // optional, date string dd/mm/yyyy 
 quoteStatus // optional, 0 by default. 
 // 0 - Not a quote 
 // 1 - Open
 // 2 - Won
 // 3 - Lost
 // 4 - Invalid

Notes: if you do not provide the address1-5 fields they will be populated by the customer record address details

For field 'orderItemsDataFromStockItemData' if true, any missing information on the invoice items will be filled in from the stock item defaults. Bare in mind this will be making a separate call for the stock data AND a separate call for the tax rate.

request.description:
Patch sales Order

  • Description: Updates Sales Order

  • Endpoint URL: api/salesOrder

  • Method: PATCH

  • Parameters:

 orderNumber // Int (max 4 chars), required
 customerAccountRef // String (max 8 chars), required, customer account must exist
 customerOrderNumber // String (max 60 chars), optional
 customerTelephoneNumber // String (max 30 chars), optional
 contactName // String (max 30 chars), optional
 userName // String (max 30 chars), optional
 address1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address3 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address4 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address5 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delName // String (max 30 chars), optional, 60 chars on V29 or newer
 delAddress1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress3 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress4 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress5 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 globalDiscountRate // Double (max 8 chars), optional, overrides line item discounts
 carrNet // Double (max 8 chars), optional 
 carrTax // Double (max 8 chars), optional
 foreignRate // Double (max 2 chars), optional
 notes1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 notes2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 notes3 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 analysis1 // String (max 30 chars), optional
 analysis2 // String (max 30 chars), optional
 analysis3 // String (max 30 chars), optional
 carrNomCode // String (max 8 chars), optional
 carrTaxCode // Int (max 2 chars), optional
 currency // Int (max 1 chars), optional, use values from sage Settings > Currencies
 departmentNumber // Int, optional
 orderDueDate // Date (dd/mm/yyyy), optional
 quoteStatus // int (max 2 chars), optional
 quoteExpiry // Date (dd/mm/yyyy), optional (only used for quotes)
 orderType // int, optional
 invoiceItems // array
        stockCode // String (max 30 chars), required
        description // String, (max 60 chars), optional
        quantity // Double (max 8 chars), required
        unitPrice  // Double (max 8 chars), required
        taxRate // Double eg 20.0 (max 8 chars), required
        taxCode // Int eg 1 (max 2 chars), required
        discount // Double eg 25.0 (max 8 chars), required
        departmentNumber // Int, required
        nominal // String (max 8 chars), required to update ledgers
        details // String, (1023 chars)
        comment1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
        comment2 // String (max 60 chars), optional 
        dueDate // Date (dd/mm/yyyy), optional
// THESE THREE FIELDS ONLY USED FOR SALES ORDER **QUOTATIONS**
 orderType // Int, optional, set to value 9 for a quote
 quoteExpiry // optional, date string dd/mm/yyyy 
 quoteStatus // optional, 0 by default. 
 // 0 - Not a quote 
 // 1 - Open
 // 2 - Won
 // 3 - Lost
 // 4 - Invalid

request.description:
Partially Allocates Sales Order

  • Description: Partially allocates a Sales Order

  • Endpoint URL: api/salesOrderPartialAllocation

  • Method: POST

  • Params:

 orderNumber //  // Required, Int
items
            itemId // Required, Int
            allocate // Required, Double

Fully Allocates Sales Order

  • Description: Fully allocates an unallocated or partially allocated sales order

  • Endpoint URL: api/salesOrder/{{id}}/fullyAllocate

  • Method: POST

  • Params: orderNumber

Fully Un-Allocate Sales Order

  • Description: Fully un-allocates an allocated or partially allocated sales order

  • Endpoint URL: api/salesOrderDeAllocation/{{id}}

  • Method: POST

  • Params: orderNumber

Partially Despatches Sales Order

  • Description: Partially despatches a Sales Order

  • Endpoint URL: api/salesOrderPartialDespatch

  • Method: POST

  • Params:

 orderNumber //  // Required, Int
items
            itemId // Required, Int
            allocate // Required, Double

Complete Sales Order

  • Description: Completes a sales order, creates goods dispatch record and a goods out stock record. Then creates Sales Invoice and returns the ID.

  • Endpoint URL: api/salesOrder/{id}/complete

  • Method: POST

  • Params: orderNumber

  • NOTES: The whole order needs to be fully allocated in Sage before using this request and the items need to be stock items.

item.name: Complete Sales Order With Own Invoice Date

request.description:
Complete Sales Order

  • Description: Completes a sales order, creates goods dispatch record and a goods out stock record. Then creates Sales Invoice with date entered and returns the ID.

  • Endpoint URL: api/salesOrderComplete

  • Method: POST

  • Params:

 orderNumber // Int (max 4 chars), required
date  // String, Date (dd/mm/yyyy), optional

response.name: Complete Sales Order With Own Invoice Date

request.description:
Hold Sales Order

  • Description: Marks Sales Order as "HELD"

  • Endpoint URL: api/salesorder/{{id}}/hold

  • Method: POST

  • Params: orderNumber

Cancel Sales Order

  • Description: Deletes sales order.

  • Endpoint URL: api/salesOrder/{id}

  • Method DELETE

  • Params: orderNumber

Search Dispatch

  • Description: Searches Dispatched Orders

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchDispatch

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e RECORD_MODIFY_DATE, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

request.description:
Post Create Purchase Order

  • Description: Creates new Purchase Order

  • Endpoint URL: api/purchaseOrder

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

 supplierAccountRef // String (max 8 chars), required
 telephoneNumber // String (max 11 chars), optional
 reference // String (max 7 chars), optional
 orderNumber // Int (max 8 chars), optional on POST required for PATCH
 supplierName // String (max 30 chars), optional
 orderDate // String (dd/mm/yyyy), optional
 userName // String (max 30 chars), required
 contactName // String (max 30 chars), optional
 address1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address3 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address4 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address5 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delName // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress3 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress4 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress5 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 notes1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 notes2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 notes3 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 carriageNet // Double (max 8 chars), required 
 carriageTax // Double (max 60 chars), required
 carriageDepartmentNumber // Double (max 8 chars), optional 
 currency // Int (max 2 chars), optional, use values from sage Settings > Currencies
 supplierOrderNumber // string (max 60 chars), optional
 departmentNumber // Int (max 2 chars), optional
 projectID // int (max 4 chars), optional
 costCodeID // int (max 4 chars), optional
 dueDate // String (dd/mm/yyyy), optional
 analysis1 // String (max 30 chars), optional
 analysis2 // String (max 30 chars), optional
 analysis3 // String (max 30 chars), optional
 invoiceItems
     stockCode  // String (max 30 chars), optional
     description // String (max 120 chars), optional
     quantity // double eg 20.0 (max 8 chars), required
     details // String, optional
     unitPrice // double eg 20.0 (max 8 chars), required
     taxRate // double, eg 20.0 (max 8 chars), required
     taxCode // int eg 1 (max 2 chars), required
     discount // double eg 25.0 (max 8 chars), required
     comment1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
     comment2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
     nominal // String (max 8 chars), optional
     dueDate // String (dd/mm/yyyy), optional
     departmentNumber // Int (max 2 chars), required
     projectRef // Int, optional
     costCode //  Int, (max 2 chars) optional
     qtyInvoiced // Int, (max 2 chars) optional

Get Purchase Order

  • Description: Fetches a single purchase order. If wanting to get full list of purchase orders use - api/searchPurchaseOrder.

  • Endpoint URL: api/purchaseOrder/{{id}}

  • Method: GET

  • Parameters: orderNumber

Purchase Order Status

Value        On Order    Delivered        
2        Full        Blank
3        Cancelled    Blank
6        Full        Part
7        Cancel        Part
8        Blank        Complete

request.description:
Patch Update Purchase Order

  • Description: Updates Purchase Order

  • Endpoint URL: api/purchaseOrder

  • Method: PATCH

  • Parameters: orderNumber

 supplierAccountRef // String (max 8 chars), required
 telephoneNumber // String(max 11 chars), optional
 reference // String (max 7 chars), optional
 orderNumber // Int (max 8 chars), optional on POST required for PATCH
 supplierName // String (max 30 chars), optional
 orderDate // String (dd/mm/yyyy), optional
 userName // String (max 30 chars), required
 contactName // String (max 30 chars), optional
 address1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address3 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address4 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 address5 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delName // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress3 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress4 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 delAddress5 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 notes1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 notes2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 notes3 // String (max 60 chars), optional
 carriageNet // Double (max 8 chars), required 
 carriageTax // Double (max 60 chars), required
 carriageDepartmentNumber // Double (max 8 chars), optional 
 currency // Int (max 2 chars), optional, use values from sage Settings > Currencies
 supplierOrderNumber // string (max 60 chars), optional
 departmentNumber // Int (max 2 chars), optional
 projectID // int (max 4 chars), optional
 costCodeID // int (max 4 chars), optional
 dueDate // String (dd/mm/yyyy), optional
 analysis1 // optional, string, max 30 chars
 analysis2 // optional, string, max 30 chars
 analysis3 // optional, string, max 30 chars
 invoiceItems
     stockCode  // String (max 30 chars), optional
     description // String (max 120 chars), optional
     quantity // double eg 20.0 (max 8 chars), required
     details // String, optional
     unitPrice // double eg 20.0 (max 8 chars), required
     taxRate // double, eg 20.0 (max 8 chars), required
     taxCode // int eg 1 (max 2 chars), required
     discount // double eg 25.0 (max 8 chars), required
     comment1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
     comment2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
     nominal // String (max 8 chars), optional
     dueDate // String (dd/mm/yyyy), optional
     departmentNumber // Int (max 2 chars), required
     projectRef // Int, optional
     costCode //  Int, (max 2 chars), optional
     qtyInvoiced // Int, (max 2 chars), optional
     quantityDiff // Int, (max 8 chars), SEE NOTES
  • Notes:

Field "quantityDiff" is required when updating a purchase order which is marked as ON-ORDER. To use this, set the "quantity" to the required amount and the "quantityDiff" is the difference. For example if you wish to update the purchase order item from 1 to 5, you set the "quantity" to 5 and the "quantityDiff" to 4. You can use a negative "quantityDiff" to reduce the quantity

Cancel Purchase Order

  • Description: Deletes Purchase Order

  • Endpoint URL: api/purchaseOrder/{id}

  • Method DELETE

  • Parameters: orderNumber

Search Purchase Items

  • Description: Searches Purchase Order Items

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchPopItem

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e STOCK_CODE, ORDER_NUMBER etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

Search Goods Received Notes

  • Description: Searches ALL Goods Received Notes in Sage.

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchGoodsReceivedNotes

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e INV_REF, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

POST Good Received Notes

  • Description: Add received notes against PO

  • Endpoint URL: api/goodsReceivedNotes

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

orderNumber // Int, required
    Items
     itemNumber // Int, required
     quantity // Int, required

Search Deliveries

  • Description: Searches ALL Deliveries in Sage.

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchDelivery

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e INV_REF, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

request.description:
Patch Sales Invoice

  • Description: Updates a new sales invoice

  • Endpoint URL: api/salesInvoice

  • Method: POST/PATCH

  • Parameters: invoiceNumber

NOTES:

  • Credit Notes with invoiceTypeCode = 3 or 4 will use next Credit Number from Sage

  • If using isNegativeLine stockCode must be S1 or S3

  • Cant use discount & isNegativeLine together

  • If using isNegativeLine overall invoice cant be negative

  • For field ‘invoiceItemsDStockItemData’ if true, any missing information on the invoice items will be filled in from the stock item defaults. Bare in mind this will be making a separate call for the stock data AND a separate call for the tax rate. Example JSON body for defaults below.

  • ignoreCustomerDiscountRate only available on creating invoices.

invoiceNumber // Int (max 7 chars), required for patch
customerAccountRef // Required, String (max 8 chars) 
orderNumber // String (max 7 chars), optional 
customerOrderNumber // String (max 60 chars), Optional
customerTelephoneNumber // String (max 30 chars), optional
contactName // String (max 30 chars), optional 
userName // String (max 30 chars), optional
name // String (max 60 chars), optional
address1 // String (max 60 chars), optional
address2 // String (max 60 chars), optional
address3 // String (max 60 chars), optional
address4 // String (max 60 chars), optional
address5 // String (max 60 chars), optional
delName // String (max 30 chars), optional
delAddress1 // String (max 30 chars), optional
delAddress2 // String (max 30 chars), optional
delAddress3 // String (max 30 chars), optional
delAddress4 // String (max 30 chars), optional
delAddress5 // String (max 30 chars), optional
carrNet // Double (max 8 chars), optional
carrTax // Double (max 8 chars), optional
carrNomCode // String (max 8 chars), Optional
carrTaxCode // Int (max 2 chars), optional
globalTaxCode // Int (max 2 chars), optional
globalDepartmentNumber // Int (max 2 chars), optional
globalDetails // String (max 60 chars), optional
globalNominal // String (max 8 chars), optional
netValueDiscountDescription // String (max 60 chars), optional
netValueDiscountAmount // Double (max 8 chars), optional
currency // Int (max 1 chars), optional, use values from sage Settings > Currencies
invoiceDate // String, Optional, format: dd/mm/yy
invoiceTypeCode // Int (max 1 chars), optional, defaults to SI 
foreignRate // Double (max 8 chars), optional
carriageDepartmentNumber // Int (max 2 chars), optional
notes1 // String (max 60 chars), Optional
notes2 // String (max 60 chars), Optional
notes3 // String (max 60 chars), Optional
settlementDueDays // Double (max 3 chars), optional
settlementDiscRate // Double (max 3 chars), optional
baseSettlementDiscRate // Int, optional
analysis1 // String (max 30 chars), optional
analysis2 // String (max 30 chars), optional
analysis3 // String (max 30 chars), optional
departmentNumber // Int (max 2 chars), Optional
discount // double (max 8 chars), optional
foreignGross // double (max 8 chars), optional
paymentDueDate // string, optional
shouldUpdateLedgers // bool, optional, defaults to false
printed // bool, optional
emailed // bool, optional
invoiceItemsDataFromStockItemData // bool, optional
ignoreCustomerDiscountRate // bool, optional, defaults to false
invoiceItems
     stockCode // String (max 30 chars), required
     description // String (max 60 chars for V28 or older, max 120 for V29 or newer), required
     quantity // Double (max 8 chars), required
     unitPrice // Double (max 8 chars), required
     unitOfSale // string, max 8 chars, optional
     taxRate // double eg 20.0 (max 8 chars), required
     taxCode // int eg 1 (max 2 chars), required
     discount // double eg 25.0 (max 8 chars), optional
     netAmount // item net after discount, double (max 8 chars), optional
     // (use instead of discount to avoid rounding issues with
     // fractional discount rates)
     nominal // String (max 8 chars), optional
     comment1 // String (mac 60 chars), optional
     comment2 // String (mac 60 chars), optional
     departmentNumber // Int (max 2 chars), optional
     extOrderRef // String (max 30 chars), optional
     projectId // int (max 4 chars), optional
     isNegativeLine // int (max 1 chars), optional // 0 = positive amount & 1 = negative amount
     serviceFlag // int, optional (set to 2 for Service Item)

invoiceTypeCode Field values

Value    Description
0    Sales Order or Product Invoice originating from Invoicing
1    Product Invoice originating from Sales Order Processing
2    Service Invoice
3    Product Credit Note
4    Service Credit Note
5    Product Invoice Proforma
6    Product Invoice Quotation
7    Service Invoice Proforma
8    Service Invoice Quotation
9    Sales Order Quotation
11    Sales Order Proforma

Post Sales Invoice

  • Description: Creates a new sales invoice

  • Endpoint URL: api/salesInvoice

  • Method: POST/PATCH

  • Parameters: see invoiceTypeCode Field values section below

NOTES:

  • Credit Notes with invoiceTypeCode = 3 or 4 will use next Credit Number from Sage

  • If using isNegativeLine stockCode must be S1 or S3

  • Cant use discount & isNegativeLine together

  • If using isNegativeLine overall invoice cant be negative

  • For field ‘invoiceItemsDStockItemData’ if true, any missing information on the invoice items will be filled in from the stock item defaults. Bare in mind this will be making a separate call for the stock data AND a separate call for the tax rate. Example JSON body for defaults below.

  • ignoreCustomerDiscountRate only available on creating invoices.

  • If sending non GBP transaction, currency must be set to match account posting to

     netAmount // item net after discount, double (max 8 chars), optional
     // (use instead of discount to avoid rounding issues with
     // fractional discount rates)
     nominal // String (max 8 chars), optional
     comment1 // String (mac 60 chars), optional
     comment2 // String (mac 60 chars), optional
     departmentNumber // Int (max 2 chars), optional
     extOrderRef // String (max 30 chars), optional
     projectId // int (max 4 chars), optional
     isNegativeLine // int (max 1 chars), optional // 0 = positive amount & 1 = negative amount
     serviceFlag // int, optional (set to 2 for Service Item)

invoiceTypeCode Field values

Value    Description
0    Sales Order or Product Invoice originating from Invoicing
1    Product Invoice originating from Sales Order Processing
2    Service Invoice
3    Product Credit Note
4    Service Credit Note
5    Product Invoice Proforma
6    Product Invoice Quotation
7    Service Invoice Proforma
8    Service Invoice Quotation
9    Sales Order Quotation
11    Sales Order Proforma

Search Invoice Items

  • Description: Searches items on invoices

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchInvoiceItem

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e RECORD_MODIFY_DATE, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

request.description:
POST Purchase Invoice

  • Description: Creates a Purchase Invoice using the TransactionPost object.

  • Endpoint URL: api/purchaseInvoice

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

accountRef // string (max 8 chars), required
date // string dd/mm/yyyy, required
invRef // string (max 30 chars), optional
details // string (max 60 chars), optional
currency // int, optional //see below notes
userName // String (max 30 chars), optional
dueDate // string, optional, dd/mm/yyyy
foreignRate // double, optional // see below notes
items
    nominalCode // string (max 8 chars), required
    taxCode // int (max 2 chars), required
    netAmount // double (max 8 chars), required
    taxAmount // double (max 8 chars), required
    exRef // string (max 8 chars), optional 
    details // string (max 60 chars), optional
    externalFileURL // string, web URL, required 
    departmentNumber // int (max 2 chars), optional 
    projectRef // string (max 12 chars), optional
    projectId // int, optional
    CostCodeId // int, optional
    costCode //  string (max 8 chars), optional
    isNegativeLine // int (max 1 chars), optional // 0 = negative & 1 = positive 
    disputed // (max 1 chars), optional // 0 = no & 1 = yes

NOTES:

  • If currency is set on purchaseInvoice, it must match the id of the currency of the associated Supplier Account.

  • If currency is set and foreignRate is not set or is ‘null’ the transaction will be stored using the Exchange Rate stored in Sage for the selected currency.

  • If using isNegativeLine: If set true, this will create a credit line on the transactions for the negative lines matching the invoice on all other information (inv ref etc)

  • If set true, the parent model cannot have the isCredit field set to true

  • If set true, the total of ALL the invoice lines must be more than the total of all the credit lines

Read Document Link

  • Description: Reads Document Link from Purchase Order

  • Endpoint URL: api/documentLink/{ID}

  • Method: GET

  • Parameters: transactionNumber

Search Projects

  • Description: Searches the PROJECT table in Sage.

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchProject

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e RECORD_MODIFY_DATE, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

request.description:
POST Create Project

  • Description: Creates a new project

  • Endpoint URL: api/project

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

projectID // String, required for patch, max 4 chars
accountRef // String, optional, max 8 chars
name // String, required, max 100 chars
reference // String, required, max 12 chars
startDate // String, required, dd/MM/yyyy
endDate // String, required, dd/MM/yyyy
description // String, required, max 255 chars
priceQuoted // Double, optional, max 8 chars
totalBudget // Double, optional, max 8 chars
orderNumber // String, optional, max 30 chars
analysis1 // string, optional, max 30 chars
address1 // optional, string, max 60 chars
address2 // optional, string, max 60 chars
address3 // optional, string, max 60 chars
address4 // optional, string, max 60 chars
address5 // optional, string, max 60 chars
status // string, required, see available status list below

Project Status values

Value        Description
ACTIVE        Active
COMPLETED    Completed, closed
INITIAL        Pre-acceptance
SNAG        Completed, open
SUSPEND        Suspended

Get Project

  • Description: Fetches a project details, search by project reference

  • Endpoint URL api/project/{id}

  • method GET

  • Parameters: id

request.description:
POST Project transactions

  • Description: Posts a project only transaction

  • Endpoint URL: api/project/{projectReference}/transactions

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

codeCodeRef // String, required, max 8 chars
date // string, required, dd/mm/yyyy
details // string, optional, max 60 chars
reference // string, optional, max 8 chars
quantity // double, required, max 8 chars
rate // double, required, max 8 chars
taxAmount // double,optional, max 8 chars
type // transaction type (see enums/types below, should be project specific such as sdoCC - Project Cost Credit)

GET Project Cost Codes

  • Description: Returns a list of all project cost codes

  • Endpoint URL: api/projectCostCodes

  • Method: GET

  • Parameters: none

response.name: Read Project Cost Codes

request.description:
Create Project Cost Codes

  • Description: Creates project cost codes.

  • Endpoint URL: api/projectCostCode

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

description // String, required, max 60 chars
reference // String, required, max 8 chars

Read Project Budgets

  • Description: Reads Project Budgets

  • Endpoint URL: api/projectBudgets

  • Method: GET

  • Parameters: none

Post Allocate Payment On Account

  • Description: Allocate payment on an account

  • Endpoint URL: api/allocatePaymentOnAccount

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

accountRef // String, required, max 8 chars
invRef // String, required, max 30 chars
paymentTransactionNumber // int, required
amount // double, required, max 8 chars
currency // Int, see notes, max 2 chars

NOTES -

  • During the allocation process, if the API is unable to find a matching transaction for the given invRef (accountRefs must match too) then the API will post an unallocated payment.

  • Currency is required if sending a non BASE (foreign) currency.

response.name: Allocate Payment On Account

request.description:
Search Audit Headers

  • Description: Searches the AUDIT_HEADER table in Sage.

  • Endpoint URL: api/search/auditHeaders

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e INV_REF, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

response.name: Search Audit Headers

request.description:
POST Transaction

  • Endpoint: api/transactionPost

  • Method: POST

  • Description: Allows you to post transactions directly into sage

  • parameters:

accountRef // String, required, max 8 chars
date // String, required,dd/mm/yyyy
nominalCode // String, required, max 4 chars
bankCode // String, only required for payments/receipts, max 8 chars
details // string, optional, max 60 chars
taxCode // int, required, max 4 chars
invRef // String, required, max 30 chars
taxAmount // double, optional (see note)
netAmount // double, optional (see note)
type // int, required, see TYPE Field, max 1 chars
amountPaid // double, optional, only used for payments, max 8 chars
exRef // String, optional, max 30 chars
currency // double, optional (see note)
Rate // double, optional (see note)
shouldAllocatePayment // bool, optional, default false (see note)
userName // string, optional, max 30 chars
dueDate // string, optional, dd/mm/yyyy
costCode // String, optional
projectID // string, optional
deptNumber // int, optional, max 3 chars
  • Notes:

The response ID given for a successful request is the HEADER_NUMBER in sage NOT TRAN_NUMBER.

Transactions must be posted in the same currency as the account you are posting to.

For base currency (GBP) transactions you must use netAmount and taxAmount fields.
For foreign currency transactions you must use foreignNetAmount, foreignRate and foreignTaxAmount fields. If the forgeignRate field is not set, it will load the rate from the currency in Sage. For Sales Receipts (SR's) on V29, the foreignRate must match the foreignRate on the Sales Invoice (SI) transaction.

When posting a PP, the invRef value should relate to the invRef value that was posted on the Purchase Invoice transaction you wish to allocate the payment against.

During the allocation process, if the API is unable to find a matching PI for the given invRef (accountRefs must match too) then the API will post a PA – Purchase Payment on Account instead.

The above behaviour is replicated on the Sales side, so if a Sales Receipt - SR cannot be matched against a Sales Invoice - SI, it will post the transaction as a SA – Sales Receipt on Account.

TYPE Field

Type  Value Description 
SI     1     Sales Invoice 
SC     2     Sales Credit 
SR     3     Sales Receipt 
SA     4     Sales Receipt on Account 
SD     5     Sales Discount 
PI     6     Purchase Invoice 
PC     7     Purchase Credit 
PP     8     Purchase Payment 
PA     9     Purchase Payment on Account 
PD     10     Purchase Discount 
BP     11     Bank Payment 
BR     12     Bank Receipt 
CP     13     Cash Payment 
CR     14     Cash Receipt 
JD     15     Journal Debit 
JC     16     Journal Credit 
VP     17     Visa Payment 
VR     18     Visa Receipt 
CC     19     Project Cost Credit 
CD     20     Project Cost Debit - Charge 
PAI    21     Project Adjustment In 
PAO    22     Project Adjustment Out 
CO     23     Project Committed Cost 
SP     24     Sales Payment 
PR     25     Purchase Receipt

POST Batch Header Transaction

  • Endpoint: api/batchtransactionPost

  • Method: POST

  • Description: Allows you to post batch transactions directly into ledger

  • parameters:

type // int, required 
date // String, required,dd/mm/yyyy
invRef // String, required, max 30 chars
accountRef // String, required, max 8 chars
bankCode // String, optional, max 8 chars
userName // string, optional, max 30 chars
dueDate // string, optional, dd/mm/yyyy
details // string, optional, max 60 chars
Lines
    nominalCode // String, required, max 4 chars
    taxAmount // double, required 
    netAmount // double, required 
    taxCode // int, required, max 4 chars
        currency // Required only to be sent with foreign rate transactions
    amount // int, optional, max 8 chars
    exRef // String, optional, max 30 chars
    deptNumber // int, optional, max 3 chars
  • NOTES

This endpoint can not be used to allocate payments.

The response ID given for a successful request is the HEADER_NUMBER in sage NOT TRAN_NUMBER.

Transactions must be posted in the same currency as the account you are posting to.

For base currency (GBP) transactions you must use netAmount and taxAmount fields.
For foreign currency transactions you must use foreignNetAmount, foreignRate and foreignTaxAmount fields. If the forgeignRate field is not set, it will load the rate from the currency in Sage. For Sales Receipts (SR's) on V29, the foreignRate must match the foreignRate on the Sales Invoice (SI) transaction.

When posting a PP, the invRef value should relate to the invRef value that was posted on the Purchase Invoice transaction you wish to allocate the payment against.

During the allocation process, if the API is unable to find a matching PI for the given invRef (accountRefs must match too) then the API will post a PA – Purchase Payment on Account instead.

The above behaviour is replicated on the Sales side, so if a Sales Receipt - SR cannot be matched against a Sales Invoice - SI, it will post the transaction as a SA – Sales Receipt on Account.

TYPE Field

Type  Value Description 
SI     1     Sales Invoice 
SC     2     Sales Credit 
SR     3     Sales Receipt 
SA     4     Sales Receipt on Account 
SD     5     Sales Discount 
PI     6     Purchase Invoice 
PC     7     Purchase Credit 
PP     8     Purchase Payment 
PA     9     Purchase Payment on Account 
PD     10     Purchase Discount 
BP     11     Bank Payment 
BR     12     Bank Receipt 
CP     13     Cash Payment 
CR     14     Cash Receipt 
JD     15     Journal Debit 
JC     16     Journal Credit 
VP     17     Visa Payment 
VR     18     Visa Receipt 
CC     19     Project Cost Credit 
CD     20     Project Cost Debit - Charge 
PAI    21     Project Adjustment In 
PAO    22     Project Adjustment Out 
CO     23     Project Committed Cost 
SP     24     Sales Payment 
PR     25     Purchase Receipt

Search Splits

  • Description: Searches the AUDIT_SPLIT table in Sage.

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchSplit

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e RECORD_MODIFY_DATE, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

request.description:
Search Usage

  • Description: Searches the AUDIT_USAGE table in Sage.

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchUsage

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e RECORD_MODIFY_DATE, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

response.name: Search Audit Usage

request.description:

  • Description: Posts a record to the bank account

  • Endpoint URL: api/bank

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

bankCode // string, required, max 8 chars
netAmount // double, required, max 8 chars
taxAmount // double, required, max 8 chars
taxCode // int, required max 4 chars
nominalCode // string, required, max 4 chars
invRef // string, optional, max 30 chars
date // date, string, dd/mm/yyyy
details // string, optional, max 60 chars
type // int, BP = 11, BR = 12

request.description:

  • Description: Posts journal entries

  • Endpoint URL: api/journal

  • Parameters:

invRef // string, optional, max 30 chars

    details // string, optional, max 30 chars
    taxAmount // double, required, max 8 chars

    taxCode // double, max 8 chars
    nominalCode // string, max 8 chars
    type // int, JC = 16, JD = 15
    deptNumber // string, optional, maximum 2 chars
    extraRef // string, optional, maximum 30 chars

request.description:
POST Fixed Assets

  • Endpoint: api/fixedAssets

  • Method: POST

  • Description: Allows you to post fixed assets directly into sage

  • parameters:

assetRef // Required, String max 8 chars
details1 // Optional, String, max 60 chars
details2 // Optional,String, max 60 chars
details3 // Optional, String, max 60 chars
employee // Optional, String max 15 chars
serialNumber // Optional, String max 60 chars
purchaseRef // Optional, String max 8 chars
balSheetNomCode // Required, String max 8 chars
profitLossNomCode // Required, String max 8 chars
depMethodCode // Optional, Int max 2 chars
depRate // Optional, Double max 8 chars
deptNumber // Optional, Int max 2 chars
assetCat // Optional, Int max 2 chars
purchaseDate // Optional, String max 2 chars
costPrice // Optional, Double max 8 chars
depLast // Optional, Double max 8 chars
depToDate // Optional, Double max 8 chars
netBook // Optional, Double max 8 chars

• Description: Searches Fixed Assets

  • Endpoint URL: `api/searchfixedAssets

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

- array
    - field // Sage table field i.e RECORD_MODIFY_DATE, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - type // See explanation below
    - value // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'
"in" // eg “value”:“(‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’,‘accountRef’)”

Fixed Assets

  • Description: Fetches fixed asset details, search by asset ref

  • Endpoint URL api/fixedAssets/{id}

  • method GET

  • Parameters: id

PATCH Fixed Asset

  • Description: Updates Fixed Asset

  • Endpoint URL: api/fixedAssets

  • Method: PATCH

  • Parameters:

assetRef // Required, String max 8 chars
details1 // Optional, String, max 60 chars
details2 // Optional,String, max 60 chars
details3 // Optional, String, max 60 chars
employee // Optional, String max 15 chars
serialNumber // Optional, String max 60 chars
purchaseRef // Optional, String max 8 chars
balSheetNomCode // Required, String max 8 chars
profitLossNomCode // Required, String max 8 chars
depMethodCode // Optional, Int max 2 chars
depRate // Optional, Double max 8 chars
deptNumber // Optional, Int max 2 chars
assetCat // Optional, Int max 2 chars
purchaseDate // Optional, String max 2 chars
costPrice // Optional, Double max 8 chars
depLast // Optional, Double max 8 chars
depToDate // Optional, Double max 8 chars
netBook // Optional, Double max 8 chars

Get API Version

  • Description: Returns API Version.

  • Endpoint URL: api/system/version

  • Method: GET

  • Parameters: none

Get Company Settings

  • Description: Returns Company Information.

  • Endpoint URL: api/company

  • Method: GET

  • Parameters: none

request.description:
Search Customers

  • Description: Searches for customers.

  • Endpoint URL: api/searchSalesLedger

  • Method: POST

  • Parameters:

    -"field" // Sage table field i.e RECORD_MODIFY_DATE, ACCOUNT_REF etc
    - "type" // See explanation below
    - "value" // the value to match in the search

The type field accepts any of the following string values

"lte" // Less than or equal
"lt" // Less than
"eq" // Equal
"ne" // Not Equal
"gt" // Greater than
"gte" // greater than or equal
"like" // combined with wildcard search e.g. ACCOUNT_REF LIKE 'TEST%'

NOTES:

  • Dates must be provided in the dd/mm/yyyy format when searching this table.

  • Fields email4 to email6 are only available on V29 of Sage and upwards
